017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
027import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
028
029import java.nio.Buffer;
030
031/**
032 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
033 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the
034 * "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
035 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the Oklab color space where
036 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, red maps to additive L (lightness), green maps
037 * to additive A (green-to-red), blue maps to additive B (violet-to-yellow), and alpha continues to be multiplicative
038 * alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at
039 * 0.0. In the tweak, red maps to multiplicative L, green maps to multiplicative A, blue maps to multiplicative B, and
040 * alpha maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative
041 * values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the LAB
042 * channels, so each LAB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times
043 * 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values for A and B that are less than 0.5 make colors closer to grayscale and
044 * values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special
045 * value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make L changes less distinct between similar colors, while
046 * higher values will "sharpen" the changes in L.
047 * <br>
048 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 1/21/2021.
049 */
050public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
051    /**
052     * How many floats are used for one "sprite" (meaning a TextureRegion).
053     */
054    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
055    /**
056     * The name of the attribute used for the tweak color in GLSL shaders.
057     */
058    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
059
060    /**
061     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
062     */
063    protected Mesh mesh;
064
065    /**
066     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
067     */
068    protected float[] vertices;
069    /**
070     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
071     */
072    protected int idx = 0;
073    /**
074     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
075     */
076    protected Texture lastTexture = null;
077    /**
078     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
079     */
080    protected float invTexWidth = 0;
081    /**
082     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
083     */
084    protected float invTexHeight = 0;
085
086    /**
087     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
088     */
089    protected boolean drawing = false;
090
091    /**
092     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
093     */
094    protected final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
095    /**
096     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
097     */
098    protected final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
099    /**
100     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
101     */
102    protected final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
103
104    /**
105     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
106     */
107    protected boolean blendingDisabled = false;
108    /**
109     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
110     */
111    protected int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
112    /**
113     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
114     */
115    protected int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
116    /**
117     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
118     */
119    protected int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
120    /**
121     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
122     */
123    protected int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
124
125    /**
126     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
127     */
128    protected ShaderProgram shader;
129    /**
130     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
131     */
132    protected ShaderProgram customShader = null;
133    /**
134     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
135     */
136    protected boolean ownsShader;
137
138    /**
139     * A packed float color added to the base color of a drawn pixel (which is typically from a Texture) after the tweak
140     * has been multiplied with that base color.
141     */
142    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
143    /**
144     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
145     */
146    protected final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5019608f, 0.49803922f, 0.49803922f, 1f); // LAB from Palette.GRAY
147
148    /**
149     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
150     * all the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
151     * L multiplier or contrast, and it won't change the A multiplier or the B multiplier.
152     */
153    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.oklab(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
154    /**
155     * A packed float color multiplied with 2.0 and the base color of a drawn pixel (which is typically from a Texture).
156     * This can be created with {@link ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)} like any other packed float color,
157     * but the LAB channels instead refer to multiplicative L, A, and B, and alpha used instead for contrast. This
158     * treats A and B as having been offset to match how Oklab normally represents chroma, centered on 0.0 instead of
159     * 0.5, before the multiplication. Giving this a channel value of 0.5 has nearly no change and 0.0 or 1.0 has
160     * extreme changes.
161     */
162    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
163
164    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
165    public int renderCalls = 0;
166
167    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
168    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
169
170    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
171    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
172
173    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
174     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
175    public ColorfulBatch() {
176        this(1000, null);
177    }
178
179    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
180     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
181    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
182        this(size, null);
183    }
184
185    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
186     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
187     * respect to the current screen resolution.
188     * <p>
189     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
190     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
191     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
192     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
193    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
194        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
195        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
196
197        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
198
199        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
200                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
201                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
202                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
203                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
204
205        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
206
207        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
208
209        int len = size * 6;
210        short[] indices = new short[len];
211        short j = 0;
212        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
213            indices[i] = j;
214            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
215            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
216            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
217            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
218            indices[i + 5] = j;
219        }
220        mesh.setIndices(indices);
221
222        if (defaultShader == null) {
223            shader = createDefaultShader();
224            ownsShader = true;
225        } else
226            shader = defaultShader;
227
228        // Pre bind the mesh to force the upload of indices data.
229        if (vertexDataType != Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray) {
230            mesh.bind(shader);
231            mesh.unbind(shader);
232        }
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
237     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
238     * for the tweak. The default ShaderProgram is built from {@link #vertexShader} and {@link #fragmentShader}; you can
239     * make edited copies of these Strings and use them to make your own ShaderProgram.
240     * <br>
241     * You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
242     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
243     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
244     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
245     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
246     */
247    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
248        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
249        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
250        return shader;
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * The default shader's vertex part.
255     */
256    public static final String vertexShader =
257              "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
258            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
259            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
260            + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
261            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
262            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
263            + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
264            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
265            + "\n"
266            + "void main()\n"
267            + "{\n"
268            + "  v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
269            + "  v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
270            + "  v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
271            + "  v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
272            + "  gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
273            + "}\n";
274    /**
275     * The default shader's fragment part.
276     */
277    public static final String fragmentShader =
278                      "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
279                    + "#define LOWP lowp\n"
280                    + "precision mediump float;\n"
281                    + "#else\n"
282                    + "#define LOWP \n"
283                    + "#endif\n"
284                    + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
285                    + "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n"
286                    + "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n"
287                    + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
288                    + "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n"
289                    + "float toOklab(float L) {\n"
290                    + "  return pow(L, 1.5);\n"
291                    + "}\n"
292                    + "float fromOklab(float L) {\n"
293                    + "  return pow(L, 0.666666);\n"
294                    + "}\n"
295                    + "void main()\n"
296                    + "{\n"
297                    + "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n"
298                    + "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *"
299                    + "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
300                    + "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n"
301                    + "  lab.x = toOklab(lab.x);\n"
302                    + "  // At this point, lab has the value of the RGBA pixel in the texture at v_texCoords, converted to Oklab color space.\n"
303                    + "  // You can do the same for v_color and even v_tweak if they come in as RGBA values.\n"
304                    + "  lab.x = (lab.x - 0.5) * 2.0;\n"
305                    + "  float contrast = exp(v_tweak.w * (-2.0 * 255.0 / 254.0) + 1.0);\n"
306                    + "  lab.x = pow(abs(lab.x), contrast) * sign(lab.x);\n"
307                    + "  lab.x = fromOklab(clamp(lab.x * v_tweak.x + v_color.x, 0.0, 1.0));\n"
308                    + "  lab.yz = clamp((lab.yz * v_tweak.yz + v_color.yz - 0.5) * 2.0, -1.0, 1.0);\n"
309                    + "  lab = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, +0.3963377774, -0.1055613458, -0.0894841775, +0.2158037573, -0.0638541728, -1.2914855480) * lab;\n"
310                    + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp("
311                    + "                 mat3(+4.0767245293, -1.2681437731, -0.0041119885, -3.3072168827, +2.6093323231, -0.7034763098, +0.2307590544, -0.3411344290, +1.7068625689) *\n"
312                    + "                 (lab * lab * lab),"
313                    + "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n"
314                    + "}";
315
316    /**
317     * A special-purpose vertex shader meant for use only here in the Oklab ColorfulBatch, this can be used to create a
318     * ShaderProgram and passed into the constructor or {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. Using this vertex shader lets
319     * you specify the batch color (or the tint) as a "normal" RGBA color, while using Oklab for the tweak. The fragment
320     * shader doesn't need to be modified here, so you can use {@link #fragmentShader} as normal.
321     */
322    public static final String vertexShaderOklabWithRGBATint =
323                      "attribute vec4 a_position;\n"
324                    + "attribute vec4 a_color;\n"
325                    + "attribute vec2 a_texCoord0;\n"
326                    + "attribute vec4 a_tweak;\n"
327                    + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
328                    + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
329                    + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
330                    + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
331                    + "\n"
332                    + "vec3 rgbToLab(vec3 start) {\n"
333                    + "  vec3 lab = mat3(+0.2104542553, +1.9779984951, +0.0259040371, +0.7936177850, -2.4285922050, +0.7827717662, -0.0040720468, +0.4505937099, -0.8086757660) *\n"
334                    + "             pow(mat3(0.4121656120, 0.2118591070, 0.0883097947, 0.5362752080, 0.6807189584, 0.2818474174, 0.0514575653, 0.1074065790, 0.6302613616) \n"
335                    + "             * (start.rgb * start.rgb), vec3(1.0/3.0));\n"
336                    + "  lab.x = pow(lab.x, 1.5);\n"
337                    + "  lab.yz = lab.yz * 0.5 + 0.5;\n"
338                    + "  return lab;\n"
339                    + "}\n"
340                    + "\n"
341                    + "void main()\n"
342                    + "{\n"
343                    + "  v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
344                    + "  v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
345                    + "  v_color.rgb = rgbToLab(v_color.rgb);\n"
346                    + "  v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
347                    + "  v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
348                    + "  gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
349                    + "}";
350
351    @Override
352    public void begin () {
353        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
354        renderCalls = 0;
355
356        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
357        if (customShader != null)
358            customShader.bind();
359        else
360            shader.bind();
361        setupMatrices();
362
363        drawing = true;
364    }
365
366    @Override
367    public void end () {
368        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
369        if (idx > 0) flush();
370        lastTexture = null;
371        drawing = false;
372
373        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
374        gl.glDepthMask(true);
375        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
376    }
377
378    @Override
379    public void setColor (Color tint) {
380        color = tint.toFloatBits();
381    }
382
383    /**
384     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
385     * For the L/A/B parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
386     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
387     * @see ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)
388     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
389     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
390     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
391     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
392     */
393    @Override
394    public void setColor (float L, float A, float B, float alpha) {
395        color = ColorTools.oklab(L, A, B, alpha);
396    }
397
398    public void setColor (final float color) {
399        setPackedColor(color);
400    }
401
402    /**
403     * Expects an int color in the format (luma, 8 bits), (chroma A, 8 bits), (chroma B, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
404     * (ignored, 1 bit).
405     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and luma in the most significant
406     */
407    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
408        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
409    }
410
411    /**
412     * Sets the color with the given L/A/B and A parameters from 0 to 255.
413     * For the L/A/B parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
414     * value. For L/A/B, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
415     * @see ColorTools#oklab(float, float, float, float)
416     * @param L like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
417     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
418     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
419     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
420     */
421    public void setIntColor(int L, int A, int B, int alpha) {
422        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
423                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
424    }
425
426    @Override
427    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
428        this.color = color;
429    }
430
431    @Override
432    public Color getColor () {
433        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
434        Color color = tempColor;
435        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
436        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
437        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
438        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
439        return color;
440    }
441
442    @Override
443    public float getPackedColor () {
444        return color;
445    }
446
447    /**
448     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
449     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
450     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
451     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
452     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
453     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
454     */
455    public void setTweak (float L, float A, float B, float contrast) {
456        tweak = ColorTools.oklab(L, A, B, contrast);
457    }
458    /**
459     * Sets the tweak using a single packed Oklab float.
460     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
461     * @param tweak a packed Oklab float, with contrast instead of alpha
462     */
463    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
464        this.tweak = tweak;
465    }
466    
467    public float getTweak () {
468        return tweak;
469    }
470
471    /**
472     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: L (8 bits), A (8 bits), B (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
473     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with L 0x78, slightly
474     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with A and B multipliers of 0x20
475     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
476     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
477     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with L in the most significant bits and contrast in least
478     */
479    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
480        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
481    }
482
483    /**
484     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
485     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
486     * @param L like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
487     * @param A cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
488     * @param B artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
489     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
490     */
491    public void setIntTweak(int L, int A, int B, int contrast) {
492        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
493                | (B << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (A << 8 & 0xFF00) | (L & 0xFF));
494    }
495
496    /**
497     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
498     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time, using two packed floats.
499     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
500     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
501     */
502    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
503        setColor(color);
504        setTweak(tweak);
505    }
506
507    /**
508     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
509     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
510     * @param addL like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
511     * @param addA cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
512     * @param addB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
513     * @param mulAlpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
514     * @param mulL like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets all L to 0) to 1 (doubles the image's L)
515     * @param mulA cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
516     * @param mulB artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
517     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
518     */
519    public void setTweakedColor(final float addL, final float addA,
520                                final float addB, final float mulAlpha,
521                                final float mulL, final float mulA,
522                                final float mulB, final float contrast) {
523        setColor(addL, addA, addB, mulAlpha);
524        setTweak(mulL, mulA, mulB, contrast);
525    }
526
527    @Override
528    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
529                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
530        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
531
532        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
533
534        if (texture != lastTexture)
535            switchTexture(texture);
536        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
537            flush();
538
539        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
540        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
541        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
542        float fx = -originX;
543        float fy = -originY;
544        float fx2 = width - originX;
545        float fy2 = height - originY;
546
547        // scale
548        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
549            fx *= scaleX;
550            fy *= scaleY;
551            fx2 *= scaleX;
552            fy2 *= scaleY;
553        }
554
555        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
556        final float p1x = fx;
557        final float p1y = fy;
558        final float p2x = fx;
559        final float p2y = fy2;
560        final float p3x = fx2;
561        final float p3y = fy2;
562        final float p4x = fx2;
563        final float p4y = fy;
564
565        float x1;
566        float y1;
567        float x2;
568        float y2;
569        float x3;
570        float y3;
571        float x4;
572        float y4;
573
574        // rotate
575        if (rotation != 0) {
576            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
577            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
578
579            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
580            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
581
582            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
583            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
584
585            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
586            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
587
588            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
589            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
590        } else {
591            x1 = p1x;
592            y1 = p1y;
593
594            x2 = p2x;
595            y2 = p2y;
596
597            x3 = p3x;
598            y3 = p3y;
599
600            x4 = p4x;
601            y4 = p4y;
602        }
603
604        x1 += worldOriginX;
605        y1 += worldOriginY;
606        x2 += worldOriginX;
607        y2 += worldOriginY;
608        x3 += worldOriginX;
609        y3 += worldOriginY;
610        x4 += worldOriginX;
611        y4 += worldOriginY;
612
613        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
614        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
615        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
616        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
617
618        if (flipX) {
619            float tmp = u;
620            u = u2;
621            u2 = tmp;
622        }
623
624        if (flipY) {
625            float tmp = v;
626            v = v2;
627            v2 = tmp;
628        }
629
630        final float color = this.color;
631        final float tweak = this.tweak;
632        final int idx = this.idx;
633        vertices[idx] = x1;
634        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
635        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
636        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
637        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
638        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
639
640        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
641        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
642        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
643        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
644        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
645        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
646
647        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
648        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
649        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
650        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
651        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
652        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
653
654        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
655        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
656        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
657        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
658        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
659        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
660        this.idx = idx + 24;
661    }
662
663    @Override
664    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
665                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
666        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
667
668        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
669
670        if (texture != lastTexture)
671            switchTexture(texture);
672        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
673            flush();
674
675        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
676        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
677        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
678        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
679        final float fx2 = x + width;
680        final float fy2 = y + height;
681
682        if (flipX) {
683            float tmp = u;
684            u = u2;
685            u2 = tmp;
686        }
687
688        if (flipY) {
689            float tmp = v;
690            v = v2;
691            v2 = tmp;
692        }
693
694        final float color = this.color;
695        final float tweak = this.tweak;
696        final int idx = this.idx;
697        vertices[idx] = x;
698        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
699        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
700        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
701        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
702        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
703
704        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
705        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
706        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
707        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
708        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
709        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
710
711        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
712        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
713        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
714        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
715        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
716        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
717
718        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
719        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
720        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
721        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
722        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
723        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
724        this.idx = idx + 24;
725    }

830    @Override
831    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
832        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
833
834        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
835
836        if (texture != lastTexture)
837            switchTexture(texture);
838        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
839            flush();
840
841        final float fx2 = x + width;
842        final float fy2 = y + height;
843        final float u = 0;
844        final float v = 1;
845        final float u2 = 1;
846        final float v2 = 0;
847
848        final float color = this.color;
849        final float tweak = this.tweak;
850        final int idx = this.idx;
851        vertices[idx] = x;
852        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
853        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
854        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
855        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
856        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
857
858        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
859        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
860        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
861        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
862        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
863        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
864
865        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
866        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
867        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
868        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
869        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
870        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
871
872        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
873        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
874        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
875        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
876        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
877        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
878        this.idx = idx + 24;
879    }
880
881    /**
882     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
883     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
884     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
885     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
886     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
887     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
888     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
889     */
890    @Override
891    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
892        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
893
894        count = (count / 5) * 6;
895        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
896        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
897        if (texture != lastTexture)
898            switchTexture(texture);
899        else {
900            remainingVertices -= idx;
901            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
902                flush();
903                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
904            }
905        }
906        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
907        final float tweak = this.tweak;
908
909        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
910        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
911        ////new way, thanks mgsx
912        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
913            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
914            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
915            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
916            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
917            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
918            vertices[v++] = tweak;
919        }
920        idx += copyCount;
921        count -= copyCount;
922        while (count > 0) {
923            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
924            flush();
925            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
926            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
927            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
928            ////new way, thanks mgsx
929            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
930                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
931                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
932                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
933                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
934                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
935                vertices[v++] = tweak;
936            }
937            idx += copyCount;
938            count -= copyCount;
939        }
940    }
941
942    /**
943     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
944     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
945     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
946     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
947     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
948     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
949     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
950     */
951    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
952        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
953
954        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
955        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
956        if (texture != lastTexture)
957            switchTexture(texture);
958        else {
959            remainingVertices -= idx;
960            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
961                flush();
962                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
963            }
964        }
965        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
966
967        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
968        idx += copyCount;
969        count -= copyCount;
970        while (count > 0) {
971            offset += copyCount;
972            flush();
973            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
974            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
975            idx += copyCount;
976            count -= copyCount;
977        }
978    }
979
980    @Override
981    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
982        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
983    }

985    @Override
986    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
987        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
988
989        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
990
991        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
992        if (texture != lastTexture) {
993            switchTexture(texture);
994        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
995            flush();
996        }
997        final float fx2 = x + width;
998        final float fy2 = y + height;
999        final float u = region.getU();
1000        final float v = region.getV2();
1001        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1002        final float v2 = region.getV();
1003
1004        final float color = this.color;
1005        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1006        final int idx = this.idx;
1007        vertices[idx] = x;
1008        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
1009        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1010        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1011        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1012        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1013
1014        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
1015        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
1016        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1017        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1018        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1019        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1020
1021        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
1022        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
1023        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1024        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1025        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1026        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1027
1028        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1029        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1030        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1031        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1032        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1033        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1034        this.idx = idx + 24;
1035    }
1036
1037    @Override
1038    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1039                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
1040        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1041
1042        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1043
1044        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1045        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1046            switchTexture(texture);
1047        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1048            flush();
1049
1050        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1051        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1052        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1053        float fx = -originX;
1054        float fy = -originY;
1055        float fx2 = width - originX;
1056        float fy2 = height - originY;
1057
1058        // scale
1059        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1060            fx *= scaleX;
1061            fy *= scaleY;
1062            fx2 *= scaleX;
1063            fy2 *= scaleY;
1064        }
1065
1066        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1067        final float p1x = fx;
1068        final float p1y = fy;
1069        final float p2x = fx;
1070        final float p2y = fy2;
1071        final float p3x = fx2;
1072        final float p3y = fy2;
1073        final float p4x = fx2;
1074        final float p4y = fy;
1075
1076        float x1;
1077        float y1;
1078        float x2;
1079        float y2;
1080        float x3;
1081        float y3;
1082        float x4;
1083        float y4;
1084
1085        // rotate
1086        if (rotation != 0) {
1087            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1088            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1089
1090            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1091            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1092
1093            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1094            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1095
1096            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1097            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1098
1099            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1100            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1101        } else {
1102            x1 = p1x;
1103            y1 = p1y;
1104
1105            x2 = p2x;
1106            y2 = p2y;
1107
1108            x3 = p3x;
1109            y3 = p3y;
1110
1111            x4 = p4x;
1112            y4 = p4y;
1113        }
1114
1115        x1 += worldOriginX;
1116        y1 += worldOriginY;
1117        x2 += worldOriginX;
1118        y2 += worldOriginY;
1119        x3 += worldOriginX;
1120        y3 += worldOriginY;
1121        x4 += worldOriginX;
1122        y4 += worldOriginY;
1123
1124        final float u = region.getU();
1125        final float v = region.getV2();
1126        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1127        final float v2 = region.getV();
1128
1129        final float color = this.color;
1130        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1131        final int idx = this.idx;
1132        vertices[idx] = x1;
1133        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1134        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1135        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1136        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1137        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1138
1139        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1140        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1141        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1142        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1143        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1144        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1145
1146        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1147        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1148        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1149        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1150        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1151        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1152
1153        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1154        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1155        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1156        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1157        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1158        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1159        this.idx = idx + 24;
1160    }
1161
1162    @Override
1163    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1164                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1165        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1166
1167        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1168
1169        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1170        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1171            switchTexture(texture);
1172        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1173            flush();
1174
1175        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1176        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1177        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1178        float fx = -originX;
1179        float fy = -originY;
1180        float fx2 = width - originX;
1181        float fy2 = height - originY;
1182
1183        // scale
1184        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1185            fx *= scaleX;
1186            fy *= scaleY;
1187            fx2 *= scaleX;
1188            fy2 *= scaleY;
1189        }
1190
1191        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1192        final float p1x = fx;
1193        final float p1y = fy;
1194        final float p2x = fx;
1195        final float p2y = fy2;
1196        final float p3x = fx2;
1197        final float p3y = fy2;
1198        final float p4x = fx2;
1199        final float p4y = fy;
1200
1201        float x1;
1202        float y1;
1203        float x2;
1204        float y2;
1205        float x3;
1206        float y3;
1207        float x4;
1208        float y4;
1209
1210        // rotate
1211        if (rotation != 0) {
1212            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1213            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1214
1215            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1216            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1217
1218            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1219            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1220
1221            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1222            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1223
1224            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1225            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1226        } else {
1227            x1 = p1x;
1228            y1 = p1y;
1229
1230            x2 = p2x;
1231            y2 = p2y;
1232
1233            x3 = p3x;
1234            y3 = p3y;
1235
1236            x4 = p4x;
1237            y4 = p4y;
1238        }
1239
1240        x1 += worldOriginX;
1241        y1 += worldOriginY;
1242        x2 += worldOriginX;
1243        y2 += worldOriginY;
1244        x3 += worldOriginX;
1245        y3 += worldOriginY;
1246        x4 += worldOriginX;
1247        y4 += worldOriginY;
1248
1249        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1250        if (clockwise) {
1251            u1 = region.getU2();
1252            v1 = region.getV2();
1253            u2 = region.getU();
1254            v2 = region.getV2();
1255            u3 = region.getU();
1256            v3 = region.getV();
1257            u4 = region.getU2();
1258            v4 = region.getV();
1259        } else {
1260            u1 = region.getU();
1261            v1 = region.getV();
1262            u2 = region.getU2();
1263            v2 = region.getV();
1264            u3 = region.getU2();
1265            v3 = region.getV2();
1266            u4 = region.getU();
1267            v4 = region.getV2();
1268        }
1269
1270        final float color = this.color;
1271        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1272        final int idx = this.idx;
1273        vertices[idx] = x1;
1274        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1275        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1276        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1277        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1278        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1279
1280        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1281        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1282        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1283        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1284        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1285        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1286
1287        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1288        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1289        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1290        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1291        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1292        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1293
1294        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1295        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1296        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1297        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1298        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1299        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1300        this.idx = idx + 24;
1301    }
1302
1303    @Override
1304    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1305        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1306
1307        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1308
1309        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1310        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1311            switchTexture(texture);
1312        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1313            flush();
1314        }
1315
1316        // construct corner points
1317        float x1 = transform.m02;
1318        float y1 = transform.m12;
1319        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1320        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1321        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1322        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1323        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1324        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1325
1326        float u = region.getU();
1327        float v = region.getV2();
1328        float u2 = region.getV2();
1329        float v2 = region.getV();
1330
1331        final float color = this.color;
1332        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1333        final int idx = this.idx;
1334        vertices[idx] = x1;
1335        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1336        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1337        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1338        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1339        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1340
1341        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1342        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1343        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1344        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1345        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1346        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1347
1348        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1349        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1350        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1351        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1352        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1353        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1354
1355        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1356        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1357        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1358        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1359        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1360        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1361        this.idx = idx + 24;
1362    }
1363
1364    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1365    @Override
1366    public void flush () {
1367        if (idx == 0) return;
1368
1369        renderCalls++;
1370        totalRenderCalls++;
1371        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1372        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1373        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1374
1375        lastTexture.bind();
1376        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1377        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1378        Buffer indicesBuffer = (Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer(true);
1379        indicesBuffer.position(0);
1380        indicesBuffer.limit(count);
1381
1382        if (blendingDisabled) {
1383            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1384        } else {
1385            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1386            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1387        }
1388
1389        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1390
1391        idx = 0;
1392    }
1393
1394    @Override
1395    public void disableBlending () {
1396        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1397        flush();
1398        blendingDisabled = true;
1399    }
1400
1401    @Override
1402    public void enableBlending () {
1403        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1404        flush();
1405        blendingDisabled = false;
1406    }
1407
1408    @Override
1409    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1410        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1411    }
1412
1413    @Override
1414    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1415        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1416        flush();
1417        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1418        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1419        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1420        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1421    }
1422
1423    @Override
1424    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1425        return blendSrcFunc;
1426    }
1427
1428    @Override
1429    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1430        return blendDstFunc;
1431    }
1432
1433    @Override
1434    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1435        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1436    }
1437
1438    @Override
1439    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1440        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1441    }
1442
1443    @Override
1444    public void dispose () {
1445        mesh.dispose();
1446        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1447    }
1448
1449    @Override
1450    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1451        return projectionMatrix;
1452    }
1453
1454    @Override
1455    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1456        return transformMatrix;
1457    }
1458
1459    @Override
1460    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1461        if (drawing) flush();
1462        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1463        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1464    }
1465
1466    @Override
1467    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1468        if (drawing) flush();
1469        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1470        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1471    }
1472
1473    protected void setupMatrices () {
1474        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1475        if (customShader != null) {
1476            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1477            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1478        } else {
1479            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1480            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1481        }
1482    }
1483
1484    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1485        flush();
1486        lastTexture = texture;
1487        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1488        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1489    }
1490
1491    @Override
1492    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1493        if (shader == customShader) // avoid unnecessary flushing in case we are drawing
1494            return;
1495        if (drawing) {
1496            flush();
1497        }
1498        customShader = shader;
1499        if (drawing) {
1500            if (customShader != null)
1501                customShader.bind();
1502            else
1503                this.shader.bind();
1504            setupMatrices();
1505        }
1506    }
1507
1508    @Override
1509    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1510        if (customShader == null) {
1511            return shader;
1512        }
1513        return customShader;
1514    }
1515
1516    @Override
1517    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1518        return !blendingDisabled;
1519    }
1520
1521    public boolean isDrawing () {
1522        return drawing;
1523    }
1524    public static final int X1 = 0;
1525    public static final int Y1 = 1;
1526    public static final int C1 = 2;
1527    public static final int U1 = 3;
1528    public static final int V1 = 4;
1529    public static final int T1 = 5;
1530    public static final int X2 = 6;
1531    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1532    public static final int C2 = 8;
1533    public static final int U2 = 9;
1534    public static final int V2 = 10;
1535    public static final int T2 = 11;
1536    public static final int X3 = 12;
1537    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1538    public static final int C3 = 14;
1539    public static final int U3 = 15;
1540    public static final int V3 = 16;
1541    public static final int T3 = 17;
1542    public static final int X4 = 18;
1543    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1544    public static final int C4 = 20;
1545    public static final int U4 = 21;
1546    public static final int V4 = 22;
1547    public static final int T4 = 23;
